intro: Atylosia mareebensis, commonly known as the Mareeb's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a radiate pattern. Atylosia mareebensis is often found in rocky soils and is a part of the local flora in regions like Yemen and Saudi Arabia.
